metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: The mkdir command is used to create new directories.
content.html: The mkdir command is used to create new directories.

content.text: It's a simple way to organize files into folders.
content.html: It's a simple way to organize files into folders.

content.text: To create a new directory, use mkdir directory_name :
content.html: To create a new directory, use mkdir directory_name:

content.code_html: mkdir new_directory

content.text: The mkdir command has several options to customize its behavior:
content.html: The mkdir command has several options to customize its behavior:

content.text: The -p option lets you create parent directories as needed.
content.html: The -p option lets you create parent directories as needed.

content.code_html: mkdir -p parent/child

content.text: The -v option prints a message for each directory created, which is helpful for tracking what happens.
content.html: The -v option prints a message for each directory created, which is helpful for tracking what happens.

content.code_html:
mkdir -v new_directory
mkdir: created directory 'new_directory'

content.text: The -m option allows you to set the file mode (permissions) for the new directories.
content.html: The -m option allows you to set the file mode (permissions) for the new directories.

content.text: This is useful for ensuring the correct permissions are set at creation.
content.html: This is useful for ensuring the correct permissions are set at creation.

content.code_html: mkdir -m 755 new_directory

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Write the command to create a directory named 'projects'.
content.html: Write the command to create a directory named 'projects'.
